about.name: Phuket
about.info_text: Phuket is a beautiful island located in the Andaman Sea, off the west coast of Thailand. It is the largest island in Thailand and is known for its stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage. Phuket is a popular destination for travelers seeking a tropical paradise with a mix of relaxation, adventure, and vibrant entertainment. Whether you want to bask in the sun, explore underwater wonders, or experience the island's unique culture, Phuket has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Area: 576 square kilometers
Province: Phuket
Time Zone: Indochina Time (UTC+07:00)
Language: Thai, English
Currency: Thai Baht (THB)
about.climate_text: Phuket has a tropical monsoon climate, with a wet season from May to October and a dry season from November to April. The island enjoys warm temperatures and is a year-round destination for travelers.

attractions_card.title: Patong Beach
attractions_card.description: Patong Beach is one of Phuket's most famous and lively beaches, known for its clear waters, water sports, and vibrant nightlife along Bangla Road.

attractions_card.title: Phi Phi Islands
attractions_card.description: The Phi Phi Islands, including Phi Phi Don and Phi Phi Leh, offer stunning natural beauty with crystal-clear waters, great diving spots, and Maya Bay, made famous by the movie 'The Beach.'

attractions_card.title: Old Phuket Town
attractions_card.description: Old Phuket Town is a historic area with colorful Sino-Portuguese architecture, charming streets, art galleries, and a mix of cultural influences.

attractions_card.title: Big Buddha Phuket
attractions_card.description: The Big Buddha is a massive marble statue that stands at 45 meters tall and offers panoramic views of the island from its hilltop location.

attractions_card.title: Similan Islands
attractions_card.description: The Similan Islands are a world-renowned diving destination with abundant marine life, coral reefs, and underwater rock formations.

attractions_card.title: Wat Chalong
attractions_card.description: Wat Chalong is Phuket's largest and most important Buddhist temple, known for its colorful architecture and serene atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Promthep Cape
attractions_card.description: Promthep Cape is a scenic viewpoint at the southern tip of Phuket, offering breathtaking sunsets and panoramic views of the Andaman Sea.

attractions_card.title: Phang Nga Bay
attractions_card.description: Phang Nga Bay is famous for its limestone karsts and emerald-green waters, making it a popular spot for boat tours and kayaking.

food_card.title: Tom Yum Goong
food_card.description: Tom Yum Goong is a popular Thai hot and sour soup with shrimp, lemongrass, and a burst of flavors from chili and lime.

food_card.title: Green Curry
food_card.description: Green Curry is a Thai curry made with green chili, coconut milk, and a variety of vegetables and meats, known for its rich and spicy taste.

food_card.title: Pad Thai
food_card.description: Pad Thai is a classic stir-fried noodle dish with a sweet and savory sauce, often served with shrimp, chicken, or tofu.

food_card.title: Som Tum
food_card.description: Som Tum is a spicy papaya salad that combines shredded green papaya, chili, lime, fish sauce, and peanuts, creating a refreshing and zesty dish.

food_card.title: Mango Sticky Rice
food_card.description: Mango Sticky Rice is a beloved Thai dessert made with ripe mango, sweet glutinous rice, and a drizzle of coconut milk.

hotels_card.title: Amari Phuket
hotels_card.description: Amari Phuket is a beachfront resort with modern amenities, offering stunning sea views and easy access to Patong Beach.

hotels_card.title: The Nai Harn
hotels_card.description: The Nai Harn is a luxury hotel overlooking Nai Harn Beach, known for its elegant rooms, fine dining, and a serene atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Katathani Phuket Beach Resort
hotels_card.description: Katathani Phuket Beach Resort is a family-friendly beachfront resort with multiple pools, restaurants, and a range of recreational activities.

hotels_card.title: The Pavilions Phuket
hotels_card.description: The Pavilions Phuket is a boutique resort offering private pool villas, scenic views, and a tranquil setting in the hills.

hotels_card.title: The Shore at Katathani
hotels_card.description: The Shore at Katathani is an intimate and luxurious beachfront resort, providing private pool villas and personalized service.

transport_card.title: Phuket International Airport
transport_card.description: Phuket International Airport is the main gateway to the island, offering both domestic and international flights, and is located near the northern part of Phuket.

transport_card.title: Tuk-Tuks and Taxis
transport_card.description: Tuk-tuks and taxis are common modes of transportation on the island, offering convenient ways to get around Phuket.

transport_card.title: Songthaews
transport_card.description: Songthaews are shared pickup trucks that serve as a budget-friendly means of transportation, traveling along set routes.

transport_card.title: Rental Scooters
transport_card.description: Rental scooters are a popular choice for exploring Phuket independently, allowing travelers to visit various attractions at their own pace.
